content.title: Art
content.subtitle: Art including artists, exhibitions, movements and the creative processes involved. Also the sale of individual artworks.

content.title: Books
content.subtitle: Literature including books, authors, plotlines, reviews and sales.

content.title: Arts / Culture / Entertainment
content.subtitle: Performing and non-performing arts; music; theatre; tv; radio; festivals; exhibitions; dance; literature; libraries; museums; painting; sculpture; government policy.

content.title: Film
content.subtitle: Motion pictures / films, including directors, actors, premieres, reviews and box office.

content.title: Living / Lifestyle
content.subtitle: Lifestyle issues including culture, hobbies / pastimes and general interest

content.title: Celebrities
content.subtitle: Personal news about individuals widely recognised, known and / or admired as a result of personal or professional achievement.

content.title: Fashion
content.subtitle: Fashion, including designers, models, fashion shows, couture, styles and fashion trends.

content.title: Music
content.subtitle: Music and musical artists. Includes details and reviews of live performances and recorded music releases.

content.title: Television
content.subtitle: Television as a medium.

content.title: Theater
content.subtitle: Dramatic stage performances and their performances. Includes theater, ballet and opera. Premieres, listings and reviews.

content.title: Tourism / Travel
content.subtitle: Travel information such as resort recommendations, air-travel routes, tour and vacation ideas, airline / travel guides, hotel packages and promotions. Includes items on or from conventions and visitors bureau.

content.title: Video Games
content.subtitle: News about the development, production, sales, and use of video games.

content.title: Asset-Backed Securities
content.subtitle: Bonds or notes that are based on pools of assets, or collateralized by the cash flows from a specified pool of underlying assets.

content.title: Mortgage Agency Debt
content.subtitle: The issuance, pricing and trading of debt securities, usually in the form of bonds, issued by mortgage agencies.

content.title: Bank Qualified
content.subtitle: News about bank-qualified bonds, which allow banks to deduct interest paid to carry those bonds. Bank-qualified bonds are typically issued for a public purpose in small amounts.

content.title: Credit and Corporate Debt
content.subtitle: The issuance, pricing and trading of corporate debt securities, including derivatives such as CDS, equity-linked bonds and covered bonds, as well as the issuance and syndication of loans to corporates.

content.title: Collateralized Debt Obligations
content.subtitle: Debt securities backed by a pool of bonds, loans and/or other assets.

content.title: Credit Default Swaps
content.subtitle: The issuance, pricing and trading of Credit Default Swaps, or any financial swap arrangement under which the seller of the CDS will compensate the buyer in the event of a loan default or other defined credit event.

content.title: Commodities Markets
content.subtitle: Production, consumption and trading in primary commodities markets, including agricultural, energy, metals and diamonds. Also includes weather and shipping news affecting commodities markets.

content.title: Debt / Fixed Income Markets
content.subtitle: Bond and other debt and credit market news, including new issues, yields and other rates, analyses, and market performance. Credit and corporate debt; government, agency, municipal and supranational debt; eurobonds and asset-backed debt.

content.title: Derivatives
content.subtitle: Derivatives including futures, options, warrants, spreads, swaps, contracts for differences and other financial instruments that derive their basic code from other instruments and assets traded for cash. New issues of derivatives, forecasts and analyses of a derivatives market, market structure.

content.title: Equity-Linked Bonds
content.subtitle: All news about equity-linked bonds, including convertible and exchangeable bonds and warrant-bearing bonds.

content.title: Exchange-Traded Funds
content.subtitle: A fund that can be continuously traded on an exchange, which is generally comprised of a basket of financial instruments mirroring the composition of a securities market index. ETFs offer low expense ratios relative to other funds and trade within a narrow spread with respect to NAV. Although the legal structure of ETFs is generally open-ended, their distinct characteristics compel investors to treat as a discrete fund type.

content.title: Eurobonds
content.subtitle: New eurobond issues in Europe; including issues by foreign borrowers in domestic markets where there is no eurobond market e.g. Swiss francs. Exclude corporate or domestic government bonds, e.g. gilts, Bunds, Samurais & Yankees.

content.title: Currencies / Foreign Exchange Markets
content.subtitle: Exchange rates and analyses of currency markets. Comments on foreign-exchange developments.

content.title: General Obligation Debt
content.subtitle: News about general obligation debt issued by state and local government entities; GO notes and taxable GO debt; general obligation certificates of participation; state appropriation debt; and news about new GO financings and new capital programs.

content.title: National Government Debt
content.subtitle: News about all national government bond and debt instrument markets. Includes treasury gilts, bonds and notes (not T-bills, which are money market instruments).

content.title: Volatile Shares / Hot Stocks
content.subtitle: News about sharp changes in the price of a share or prices of several shares in the same market sector.

content.title: High-Yield Securities
content.subtitle: The issuance, pricing and trading of debt securities that carry a relatively high risk of default and thus pay a relatively high yield, also sometimes known as junk bonds.

content.title: Investment Grade Securities
content.subtitle: The issuance, pricing and trading of debt securities that carry a relatively low risk of default and thus pay a relatively low yield.

content.title: Index-Linked Bonds
content.subtitle: Bonds linked to an underlying index, usually inflation.

content.title: Insurance-Linked Securities
content.subtitle: The issuance, pricing and trading of financial instruments whose codes are driven by insurance loss events.

content.title: Loans
content.subtitle: Issuance, syndication, trading of loans by banks (or institutional investors) to corporate or institutional borrowers; trends in loan markets and issuance.

content.title: Money Markets
content.subtitle: All money market news; reports about money markets. Trading in all money market instruments. Short-term borrowing and lending between banks.

content.title: Mortgage-Backed Markets
content.subtitle: Mortgage-backed debt and securities, mortgage advances and changes in mortgage rates and conditions.

content.title: Aluminum
content.subtitle: Extraction, transport, processing, trading / broking, demand for and use of aluminum (var. aluminium). Organisations associated with aluminum.

content.title: Bunker Fuel
content.subtitle: Production, transport, processing, trading / broking, demand for and use of bunker fuel, the heavy fuel oil used by ships, and marine diesel.

content.title: Chromium
content.subtitle: Extraction, transport, processing, trading / broking, demand for and use of chromium. Organisations associated with chromium.

content.title: Credit / Debt Ratings
content.subtitle: The issuing of an assessment of the credit worthiness of borrowers and potential borrowers. These published ratings for securities such as preferred stock and debt issues are based on the likelihood of consistent and timely payments.

content.title: Bond Inventory Balances
content.subtitle: News about bond inventory balances and unsold balances and account-closed and free-to-trade announcements.

content.title: Central Banks / Central Bank Events
content.subtitle: Policies of and changes at any central bank, reserve bank, or monetary authority.

content.title: European Union
content.subtitle: Stories about the European Union, its institutions and the European Parliament.

content.title: G7
content.subtitle: The Group of Seven (G7) nations which was formed in 1975 to facilitate economic cooperation among the seven major non-communist economic powers.

content.title: G8
content.subtitle: The Group of Eight (G8) nations. Formed in 1998, the G8 adds Russia to the G7 group of major industrialized nations.

content.title: Luxury Goods / Services
content.subtitle: Manufacturers and retailers of luxury goods. Suppliers of luxury services.

content.title: Mining
content.subtitle: Stories about miners and processors of metals and minerals, coal and construction-related materials.

content.title: Technology / Media / Telecoms
content.subtitle: Companies active in the technology, media or telecommunications industries.

content.title: Conflicts / War / Peace
content.subtitle: Civil and international wars, including violent political uprisings.

content.title: Defense
content.subtitle: The affairs of the various branches of the armed services in an individual country or alliance of countries, including defense procurement and weapons policy. Excluding actual combat.

content.title: Asylum / Immigration / Refugees
content.subtitle: Asylum, immigration, refugees, visa, passport and extradition issues.

content.title: Anti-competitive Behaviour / Price Fixing
content.subtitle: News about alleged or actual anti-competitive commercial behaviour by companies or their officers which if proven would be punishable in law.

content.title: Crime / Law / Justice
content.subtitle: Crime, law and justice.

content.title: Hijacking / Piracy
content.subtitle: Commandeer a vehicle by coercion, sometimes for political or percuniary motives.

content.title: Disasters / Accidents
content.subtitle: Natural disasters such as floods, earthquakes, hurricanes and volcanic eruptions; manmade disasters and accidents, including road accidents, plane crashes, train crashes, shipwrecks and industrial accidents; their human and economic consequences.

content.title: Floods
content.subtitle: Floods, tidal waves and tsunami including damage and loss of life, clean up and rebuilding, long-term implications and insurance costs.

content.title: Ground Accidents / Collisions
content.subtitle: Major road or rail accidents.

content.title: Human Interest / Brights / Odd News
content.subtitle: Unusual human interest items. Covers both the bizarre and the humorous. Strange but true stories.

content.title: Overseas Development Aid
content.subtitle: Overseas development policy and development aid. Includes emergency relief aid

content.title: EU Institutions
content.subtitle: News about the European Commission, Parliament, Courts and Councils.

content.title: Fundamental Rights / Civil Liberties
content.subtitle: Policies concerning claimed fundamental human rights and civil liberties.

content.title: Buddhism
content.subtitle: A religious system from ancient Nepal and India, founded by Siddhartha Gautama (the Buddha), that says moral behaviour can lead to Nirvana, the state of enlightenment and end of reincarnation. Its main branches are Theravada (dominant in South and Southeast Asia) and Mahayana (in China, Japan, Tibet and northern Asia).

content.title: Judaism
content.subtitle: The monotheistic religion of the Jews, tracing its origins to Abraham with spiritual and ethical principles embodied chiefly in the Hebrew Scriptures and the Talmud. Apart from Orthodox Judaism, there are Conservative, Hasidic, Reform and other movements.

content.title: Religion / Belief
content.subtitle: Religion / Belief.

content.title: Environment
content.subtitle: Conservation; green issues; recycling; energy saving; alternative energy; natural world; environmental disasters; environmental politics; natural resources; waste; government policy.

content.title: Genetically Modified Organisms
content.subtitle: Genetically modified organisms their development, deployment and any products made from them. Also including government policy and opposition to.

content.title: Health / Medicine
content.subtitle: Health; disease; medical research; preventative medicine; hospitals; government policy.

content.title: Doping / Drugs Tests
content.subtitle: The use, regulation or prohibition of performance-enhancing substances and tests to uncover the use of drugs, mostly used in sports.
